column4: Hey all, installing 6.06 Server, the installer seems to be stuck on the "Configuring man-db..." step, been there for over a minute... any ideas? :-/
just wait. some configure commands take a while
I'm being patient, just seems an odd one... :)
that sounds bad, kill it and try dpkg --configure -a
yeah, it's still at that same "Configuring man-db..." step... :-/
how can I kill it when it's part of the install process?
ah, it's not an upgrade but you are installing Ubuntu right now?
correct :)
6.06 Server i386 install CD
in that case I'd recommend rebooting, checking the cd and then restarting the install
with <alt><f4> (right now) you should be able to see more info
I'm rebooting and testing the CD right now, but Alf-F4 only said "11:37 Setting up ubuntu-standard..." no errors or anything, very odd
CD test was fine, I'm going to try installing again...
now it's stuck at "Configuring ltrace..." :(
is that earlier or later in the process?
I'm not sure, they were both ni the 70% range
how much memory do you have? and how much diskspace on '/' ?
1GB of RAM, and I allocated the / partition 500MB, also: /home, /var, /usr, /tmp, /root all had their own partitions
how much on /var?
thanks, I'll take a look
no errors in syslog, maybe it's a bad disk or something... :_(
